ach_anemic_desc: As a Tanner, get infected by Wolves and subsequently lynched.
ach_meniscus_desc: As Serial Killer, get injured by Grave Digger, but survive to kill him the next night.

bg_info_text: Card layouts, tokens, player boards. Perfect for fans of IRL play, printing prototypes, or just imagining the village on a game board.
bg_angel_ability: Bring back a dead player, but at the sacrifice of another player of your choosing.
bg_angel_condition: This can only happen once per game.
bg_virgin_ability: When killed in the night, choose another player to sacrifice themselves to keep you alive.
bg_damsel_ability: When in danger of being eliminated, the Damsel becomes desperate and picks two players that must switch roles immediately.
bg_flirt_ability: Picks one player per night and distracts them from using their ability.
bg_flirt_condition: Each player can only be flirted with once per game.
bg_nature_ability: Is aware of who has the Seer role. They must protect that player at all costs.
bg_nature_condition: Must sacrifice themselves after a successful vote has been placed on the Seer to keep them in the game.
bg_shifter_ability: Can take the form of any one role during the night. This becomes your identity for the game but is powerless.
bg_shifter_strategic: Helpful for the Werewolf team to confuse Villagers, forcing them to choose between two people claiming the same role.
bg_shifter_note: The card artwork looks like a Villager, but it‚Äôs an illusion.
bg_fairy_ability: Sprinkles fairy dust (or sand) on a player in the night. That player sleeps in and cannot talk during the next day phase.
bg_story_ability: The ability alters the moderator's story for one round.
bg_story_note: A unique mechanic that changes the narrative flow of the game.
bg_miracle_ability: If eliminated first, becomes reborn as soon as a Villager role vote passes to be burned.
bg_infected_trigger: If the Werewolves pick you in the night, you become a Werewolf and replace another wolf of your choice. The selected werewolf dies.
bg_hitman_objective: Each Hitman has to outlast the other. The last Hitman standing must continue playing until all Werewolves are revealed.
bg_rebirth_ability: If killed, comes back as a random character from the characters who have already been killed.
cookie_hero_desc: We use digital cookies. Sadly, you cannot eat them.
cookie_s1_p1: Cookies (and Local Storage) are small pieces of text sent to your browser by a website you visit. They help the site remember information about your visit, which makes it easier to visit the site again and makes the site more useful to you.
cookie_s1_p2: At Wolf Blood Workshop, we keep it simple. We don't use invasive tracking cookies to sell your data to the highest bidder.
cookie_s2_desc: We primarily use Local Storage, which stays on your device and isn't sent to our servers. Here is exactly what we store:
cookie_row1_desc: Remembers if you prefer Dark Mode (Default) or... well, there is only Dark Mode.
cookie_row2_desc: Remembers which "New" roles you have clicked on so the notification dot disappears.
cookie_row3_desc: Prevents you from voting on the same role multiple times (Basic spam protection).
cookie_s3_desc: We use some external tools that might place their own cookies. We don't control these, but they are standard for the web:
cookie_s3_li1: Loader Animation (Three.js): Loads graphics libraries from CDNs (Content Delivery Networks) which may cache files for faster loading.
cookie_s3_li2: Telegram Links: Clicking "Join the Pack" takes you to Telegram. They have their own cookie policy, which is probably much longer than ours.
cookie_s4_p1: If you really hate these helpful little files, you can delete them.
cookie_s4_p2: Go to your browser settings (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) -> Privacy & Security -> Clear Browsing Data. Select "Cookies and other site data."
cookie_s4_warning: Warning: If you do this, the site might forget which roles you've already voted for.

evo_intro_text: EVO MOD is about upgrading classic roles into monstrous versions of themselves. This is for chaotic thrill-seekers who want to watch their game spiral into beautiful madness.
desc_base_drunk: Congrats! You're the village drunk! (and really, everyone knows it...). Usually just a villager, but if Wolves eat you, they miss their kill the next night.
desc_base_apprentice: You are the apprentice seer. If the (real) seer dies, you will take their place as the seer.
desc_base_chemist: You are the Chemist, a mad scientist experimenting on living beings. On the first night, you prepare 4 potions (2 poison, 2 harmless). You can choose a target to give one of each.
desc_base_mayor: You are the Mayor. Your vote counts as two during the day once revealed.
desc_base_mason: You are a Mason. If there are any other masons, you will know who they are. Otherwise, you are a villager.
desc_base_alpha: You are the Alpha Wolf; the source of the scourge. Each night, you will choose a human to attack and kill, but as long as you are alive, your victim has a 20% chance of turning into a werewolf.
desc_base_boss: You have a strong dislike for cultists. Whenever you encounter a cult, you join their ranks by pretending to be one of them.
desc_base_augur: You are the Augur. You are the only one who can see roles that are not in the village!
desc_base_tanner: You are the tanner. If you get lynched, you win automatically!
desc_base_arsonist: You are the Arsonist. Each night, you may either douse a house with kerosene or spark, burning all previously doused houses.
desc_base_wolfman: You are the WolfMan! The Seer will get confused and think you are a werewolf!
desc_base_lycan: You are the lycan! You are a wolf, but the seer will be confused and see you as a villager :)
desc_base_cult_hunter: You are the Cultist Hunter. Each night, choose a player. If they are a cultist, they die.
desc_base_cultist: You are a cultist. Every night, you may choose a player to convert to a cultist.
desc_base_shadow_wolf: You are a Shadow Wolf. When you use your abilities, the shadows will hide the villagers' votes.
desc_base_snow_wolf: You are the Snow Wolf. Every night you freeze someone. A frozen person will be unable to use any night actions.
desc_base_beholder: You are the beholder, you will be told who the (real) seer is - that is your only function.
desc_base_hunter: You are the town Hunter. If you die, you can choose someone else to kill.
desc_base_pawn: Every night you will choose someone to protect. If your target gets attacked, you will sacrifice yourself.
desc_base_slave: You win if your target is lynched.
desc_base_poseidon: Once per game, you can kill a random player on the village team by unleashing a tsunami.
desc_base_sorcerer: At night you will use your power to find the wolves or the Seer. You win only if the wolves win.
desc_base_detective: During the day, you may choose a player to reveal their role. However in doing so, your role could be revealed to the wolves! (40% chance).
desc_base_guardian: You are the Guardian Angel. Each night, you may choose a player to save.
desc_base_clumsy: You are a regular villager, but your clumsiness sometimes causes you to vote for the wrong person randomly.
desc_base_seer: You are the seer. Each night, you may choose a player to 'see', and reveal their role to you.
desc_base_fool: The fool is told they are the seer.... when they choose to see someone's role at night, they are told a random role.
desc_base_skeleton: You are the Skeleton. After death, your spirit continues to live and you can block the abilities and voting of any player for 1 day. One time use.
desc_base_traitor: Traitor! For now, you are a villager, but once all the wolves die, you will become a werewolf.
desc_base_gunner: You are the gunner. You have two bullets. During the day, you may choose to shoot another player.
desc_base_harlot: You are the Harlot. During the night, you may choose to visit another player.
desc_base_cursed: You are cursed. You are a villager at this time, but if the wolves choose to kill you, you will become a werewolf yourself.
desc_base_doppelganger: You are a Doppelg√§nger. Choose a player, when that player dies, you will take on their role.
desc_base_cupid: You are Cupid. You get to choose two players to love each other for eternity. If one of them dies, the other one dies of sorrow.
desc_base_wise: You are the Wise Elder. You can survive a werewolf attack once.
desc_base_wild_child: You are a wild child! Pick a player to be your 'role model' - if they die, you become a werewolf.
desc_base_rogue_wolf: You are the Rogue Wolf. During the first night, you have the opportunity to select one player to impersonate.
desc_base_illusionist: If seer checks you, they‚Äôll see that fake role instead. If you get lynched, the unlucky villager tied to your illusion goes down with you!
desc_base_snitch: On his final breath, snitch can make any player reveal their identity by snitching on their deepest darkest secret.
desc_base_conjurer: You are the Conjurer Wolf. When you use your talent, the person with the fewest votes in the lynching vote will die.
desc_base_executioner: Once revealed, the villagers are now required to cast their votes for the Executioner's chosen target.
desc_base_soldier: When the sun rises, you can choose to save someone from lynching votes.
desc_base_preacher: You are the Preacher. During the night, you can pray for a player.
desc_base_serial_killer: You are the serial killer. Recently escaped from the local asylum, your goal is for everyone else to die.
desc_base_miner: You're a Miner. Every night you dig tunnels into villagers' houses.
desc_base_doctor: You are the Doctor, with a single touch, you can bring a player back to life.
desc_base_wolf_cub: If you happen to be killed, your wolf pack will fly into a rage and attack two people the next night.

When you die choosing only one simple sinner for killing yourself is not enough! Make the massacre... Kill them all as much as you can... desc_evo_conjurer: Votes will be mixed up, and they thought the person get lynch who gets less vote. No matter what condition is, you are the one who will decide to get lynch. You will do that by a single vote. Your vote will be also hidden. All players though you vote someone else.
desc_evo_executioner: Put someone on trial. they will vote for target fate. If your target was innocent, then you will give another decide for who says "Yes" to lynch. Until you find the evil, it will continue.
desc_evo_soldier: You will got your target back as a loyal soldier! Whoever try to hesitate kill your target, you will get them immediately! During day and night or lynch phase, any time you can cover your target back.
desc_evo_preacher: You have been gifted by God. You will pray entire night for your target. Might have 50% chance to survive but even your target is die, you will know the murderer identity. Cult is weak against your worship. They will not succeed but they will also become a villager if the newest member try to convert you!
desc_evo_serial_killer: Do you want to know what evolution do you have? What can you be more? Simple, every night you get more victim from previous night. You will get a strike!

desc_evo_miner: Your diggings will be permanent until you die. You can not dig same person more than once in game. But... Since you may dig everyone's house, someone must die. Well that mean it is your turn and say goodbye to world. You can't dig for your house.
desc_evo_doctor: Do you remember the oath you took? The Hippocratic Oath. That's why you have to save every life you can. Even the bad guys... You can save life even they don't deserve. For the records, you will win according to how much life did you save from one side. If you save more village roles, you belongs to village. If you save more bad roles, you belongs to any villain
desc_evo_wolf_cub: When you get killed somehow, next night the Wolf pack attacks 3 times. That furry can't be dodged by silver dust.
faq_hero_desc: Knowledge is power. Ignorance is death.
faq_q_idea: How do I get my role idea into the game?
faq_a_idea: Simple. Go to the Home page and fill out the "Suggest a Role" form. If the Alpha Developers like it, it will be added to the "Test Designs" page for the community to vote on.
faq_q_missing: I submitted an idea, but I don't see it. Why?
faq_a_missing: The wolves are picky. We receive hundreds of ideas. If your idea is too similar to an existing role, breaks the game balance, or isn't detailed enough, it might be discarded. Check the Graveyard (Removed) page just in case.
faq_q_duplicate: What happens if two people submit the same idea?
faq_a_duplicate: Great minds think alike. We usually credit the first person who submitted it, or we may combine elements from both suggestions into one ultimate role.
faq_q_cultrate: What in the dark arts is "Cult Rate"?
faq_a_cultrate:
What is the Cult Rate?
The Cult Rate is a metric that determines the relative strength, weakness, or faith level of each specific role within the game. We strive for balance; however, if you believe the current rates are unfair or could be improved, you are encouraged to submit your suggestions for adjustments to ensure a more balanced gameplay experience.
faq_a_balance: Not always! That's why they are in testing. Use them at your own risk. If a role is too overpowered (OP), the community will vote to nerf it in the next patch.
faq_a_evomod:
What is Evo Mod?
Evo Mod (Evolution Modification) is an advanced game mode designed for those who thrive in chaos. In this mode, roles evolve into significantly more powerful, unpredictable, and unbalanced versions of themselves. It is specifically crafted for experienced players seeking a high stakes, high-impact gameplay experience. For a full breakdown of these chaotic evolutions, visit the Evo Mod page.
faq_q_official: Is this an official update from the original developers?
faq_a_official: This project is a community-driven expansion developed with the knowledge of the Bot Developer. The core vision and creative direction are led by our Web Designer, @Halfcelse. It serves as a collaborative hub where players can vote on concepts, find inspiration, and share their own ideas to help shape the future of the game.
faq_q_bug: I found a bug in a Test Design. Who do I tell?
faq_a_bug: Don't keep it to yourself. Join our Telegram Community and report it in the "Bug Hunt" channel.

lic_sec6_p1: If you wish to use our designs for a commercial project, a tournament with an entry fee, or a public software fork, you must obtain permission first.
pol_hero_desc: Your secrets are safe with the pack... mostly.
pol_sec1_text: Welcome to the Wolf Blood Workshop. This is a community-run fan project dedicated to the evolution of the game. We value your trust and are committed to protecting your privacy, even though we are just a bunch of wolves playing games.
pol_sec2_text: We believe in minimalism. We do not require you to create an account to view the site. However, we collect specific data when you interact with our tools:
pol_sec2_li1: Role Suggestions: When you submit a role idea via our forms, the content of that suggestion (Role Name, Ability, Description) becomes public community data. Do not include personal information (names, emails, phone numbers) in these fields.
pol_sec2_li2: Usage Data: We may use standard web analytics to see which pages (e.g., "Graveyard" vs "Test Designs") are most popular.
pol_sec3_text: We use local storage technology (similar to cookies) to enhance your experience. This is strictly functional:
pol_sec3_li1: Theme Preferences: Saving your preference for Dark Mode (which is the only mode, let's be honest).
pol_sec3_li2: Read States: Remembering which "New" roles you have already clicked on so we don't annoy you with notifications.
pol_sec3_note: You can clear this data at any time by clearing your browser cache.
pol_sec4_text: Our workshop contains links to external platforms, primarily Telegram. Once you click these links, you leave our territory. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of Telegram or any other third-party sites.
pol_sec5_text: Since we do not store personal accounts, we cannot "delete your account." However, if you accidentally submitted personal information in a Role Suggestion form, please contact us via our Telegram community immediately, and an Admin will scrub the data manually.
pol_sec6_text: If you have questions about this policy or want to report a privacy concern, summon the admins in our Telegram group.
grave_wip_text: Roles here are either removed or undergoing heavy reconstruction.
desc_wizard_old: Wizard : It is a neutral role until one dies from the spells. However, if a role from the village dies as a result of the spells, you will join the wolf team. It is recommended that you keep this role. During 1 day of voting, you will secretly confuse everyone and cause the death of a random person. If a villager dies as a result of random votes, you make an alliance with the wolves or you become a simple villager.
desc_communist_old: Communist. He wins only in the event of a tied lynching.
desc_communist_new: If the lynch ties, you will be one who decide to lynch someone for once.
desc_snitch_old: The Snitch is a simple villager. It can choose a player during the first night and has the ability to reveal the role of the player to everyone if the snitch dies. But if the chosen player dies before the snitch, it will only be a simple villager.
note_snitch: Note: It is not a 120 second role, and can appear in an 8 player game.
desc_snitch_new: Snitch is the nosiest resident in the entire village. His passion for gossip has led him to learn everyone‚Äôs hidden truths. On his final breath, snitch can make any player reveal their identity by snitching on their deepest darkest secret. Additionally, if the wolves dare to attack Snitch, there‚Äôs a 25% chance that one wolf‚Äôs identity gets revealed.
desc_traveler_old: Traveler : A traveler is a peasant who loves to travel. During his travels, he discovers a merchant and the merchant offers him the remaining 4 roles. The traveler chooses which role he wants to take and transforms into that role. If he doesn't like the roles, he can continue playing as a traveler.
desc_traveler_new:
You are on the road at the day time. You will visit players and you will make them an offer about if they want to change their roles against your offer. If they accept, you can sold that role another player. If they not, you will continue the searching.
Note: Players can choose bad roles too, only thing is you are not able to know what did you offer.
desc_timelord_old: Time Lord : If the Time Lord dies, the day and night timers are significantly reduced. The day is reduced to a total of 60 seconds and the night to 30 seconds. Its effect will only last for 1 day.
desc_timelord_new: You can reveal yourself during the day per once in game. If you do that, from the next night until the end of the lynch, all periods time will be limited as 30 second.
desc_spy_old:
Spy. Each night he researches a player and determines whether that person has a good role or a bad role. However that information is only 30% accurate, because he lack of reliable sources.

OR

Spy. He researches two players every night and determine if they belong to the same team. However, when he sees 2 players on the same team, he cannot use his skills the next night.
desc_spy_new: At the beggining of the day time, they will be told to you have many players have night action.
desc_terrorist_old: Terrorist. This crazy guy blinded by his own twisted beliefs, puts mines on players at night without being seen. If he gets murdered by a serial killer or a wolf at night, all the mines will explode and will take their lives with him. Loses when lynched.
desc_suicider_new:
Your purpose as named to suicide. You will plant a bomb every night to the house. You will do this twice per night. If you die with any way, the bombs will be exposed.
Note: If you could not plant any bomb before your death, you will be lose. You must kill someone at least.

If you get a bullet from Town Hunter/Gunner, you will expose yourself and randomly players will die (amount of numbers and targets are random). If they lynch you, you will only kil ¬º players in current game.
desc_panda_old: Panda. If he is killed in any way, he'll blow up before he dies and freeze all the villagers around him. The villagers cannot perform night-time actions for a day. He must be protected at all costs.
desc_gorilla_old: Gorilla. It is the strongest and most durable role in the village. When wolves attack the Gorilla, they could hurt it but they can‚Äôt kill it. The gorilla dies 1 day after being attacked.
desc_missionary_old: Missionary. [Cultist Team] He's been the most respected member of the cult for a long time. Since he's been with the cult for a long time, he can now convince 1 person to enter the cult by 100%. He can only do this once, and the player he chooses will turn into a 100% cult. This is a good opportunity to transform people with a 0% conversion percentage that never believes. Still, he can't convert bad roles.
desc_agent_old: Agent. [Cultist Team] The cult brainwashed him and made him serve them now. Before the cults converts, they'll ask him which player has what percentage of turning into a cult. Every night, his job is to find out what percentage a player has to join the cult and then inform the cult.
desc_naughty_old: Naughty Boy. He's a very spoiled and prankish child. On the first night in the game you can choose 2 players to change their roles and their roles change. If he does not change anyone's role, he will continue to play as a normal villager.
desc_preacher_old: Preacher. He is someone who loves the villagers a lot and prays for them when they die. When one person from the village team is lynched and dies, the preacher gets an extra vote. When he chooses to use his talent, he apply all his voting rights during the lynching. This can only be done 1 time.
desc_mortician_old: Mortician. He deals with the villagers funerals. Night after night, he can choose a player who was killed and reveals 2 possible suspects. If he chooses a player who was killed by a serial killer, 3 suspects will appear.
desc_idiot_old: Idiot. If the villagers choose to lynch him, he doesn‚Äôt¬† die and his role will be revealed. His votes after this point will be considered invalid.
desc_spiritualist_old: Spiritualist. The spiritualist can communicate with the spirits. Thus, he can bring a dead player to life, but when he does, he dies, like a sacrifice. He only can change places with dead players. It can only be done once per game.
desc_junior_wolf_old: Junior Wolf. The Junior Wolf can choose the player he wants to die with, at any night of the game. So, when the young wolf dies, that person will also die.
desc_goat_old: Goat. The Goat is a neutral role. He is assigned a role from the players living in the village and he must to lynch that role until the end of the game. Only roles of the village team are showed. If there are 2 of the same role, he can lynch any 1 of them. If he can't get his target lynched, he loses.
desc_mage_old: Mage. The mage is in the team of wolves. He has 2 spells and can only use 1 of them. 1.Magic: It can make the village skip the lynching time. 2.Magic: Randomly causes the death of 1 player during a lynching.
desc_messenger_old: Messenger. He can set 1 person as a target every 2 nights. When the messenger dies, the role of his target will be shown to a random person in the game. This person could also be a werewolf.
desc_messenger_new:
When he dies, at the day time 2 players role will reveal. One player will be village side the another one will be any bad rol. Their rol shown as diverted. You must figure out who is real.

When he dies, at the day time 2 players role will reveal as Werewolf. One of them is real werewolf but the other one will be randomly innocent villager.
desc_barbarian_old: Barbarian. He is quite irritable because of his anger against wolves. He can show his rage to everyone at any moment. When the barbarian shows this ability, the daytime phase will be skipped to be able to lynch the wolves immediately, and the lynching phase will last 15 seconds.
desc_trapper_old: Trapper. He sets up traps for villagers and execute them. But if the executed player belongs to the village team, the trapper will be executed with him. If he does not belong to the village team, the player dies. This ability can only be used 2 times.
desc_trapper_new:
You will set up some traps at night into the house. If you set up on the night action role houses, they will die when they try to go outside. If you set up on Serial Killer house, he will survive but can not attack next night. You can only set up the traps once for every house, can not twice at the same house. If you try the Town hunter house, as you know he always awake and he will see you as a threat and shoot you immediately.
or
If he set up a trap into an house and if they don‚Äôt have action, trapper will not set up another one until the target die. Because trapper only have 1 trap. The target must die for using one more time the same trap.
desc_criminal_old: Criminal. A regular villager, but when the Serial Killer attacks he, he kill them and take their knife, becoming the new Serial Killer.
desc_criminal_new:
You are an evil ally. You can cooperate with any bad roles. Your goal is manage to beat village team. Like poseidon you will take an action on day time but the players will not be notified. After the night, all prisoners will be free for a night and any village role will not go outside. Only bad roles can take action that time. And don‚Äôt forget that they can kill/convert you too but as a pure form you can cooperate with them.
or
When it reveals, every bad roles action will be doubled.
desc_gambler_old: Gambler. Gambler is a solo player. At night, he tries to predict who will be lynched the next day. If he correctly predicts two lynchings, he wins the game.
desc_protester_old: Protester. You don't like the presence of bad roles in the village and can start a protest once in the game. As a result, all votes for the day will be hidden, and the votes of the bad roles will be considered invalid.
desc_sacrifice_old: Sacrifice. You sacrifice yourself for the sake of the villagers. You can choose to redirect all attacks towards yourself for one night. This means that if a player was supposed to die that night, you will die instead. This ability can only be used once per game. If there are no attacks, the ability is wasted.
desc_listener_old:
Listener. You are the Listener. Your ears can pick up sounds around you very well, and you can hear what other players are saying to each other.
You can hear what the Wolf or Cult team are talking about.
However, you cannot hear who said what and what the Alpha Wolf said.
desc_guardian_wolf_old: Guardian Wolf. You are the Guardian Wolf. You can protect the werewolves on your team from being lynched. At night you can choose a teammate and the wolf you choose will be protected from being lynched the next day. This can only be done 2 times per game, but if you successfully protect 1 teammate, your ability will not be used again.
desc_analyst_old: Analyst. You are the Analyst. Through your research in the village, you have discovered an ability. Now you can instantly restore any ability used by a player. This can be done once per game and cannot be used on the first night. You should be careful because this ability also works on werewolves.
desc_illusionist_old: You are a wolf with magical abilities. When you are about to die by lynching, you can use your dark magic to redirect the lynch vote to another player. However, you only have 20 seconds to cast your spells before your death so you must hurry, and when you do, your true identity will be revealed to everyone.
desc_illusionist_new:
You have magnificant skills. An incredible consumer wolf. When seer or detective check you, they will see you as another village role and that role will be exist in game. Also that role will have been told you at the beggining of the game.
If they lynch you, you will kill that role with yourself too. If that role died before you, random player will die with you.
terms_hero_desc: Read the rules before you join the hunt.
terms_sec1_text: By accessing or using the Wolf Blood Workshop, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to abide by these rules, you must leave the pack immediately (close the tab).
terms_sec2_text: The core of this workshop is community creativity. By submitting a role, game mode, or modification idea via our forms:
terms_sec2_li1: You grant the Wolf Blood Community a perpetual, royalty-free license to use, modify, display, and distribute your idea.
terms_sec2_li2: You acknowledge that your idea may be edited for balance (e.g., nerfing a "God Role") before being published to the Test Designs page.
terms_sec2_li3: You waive any claim to intellectual property rights over the mechanics you suggest. We do this to prevent legal disputes if we decide to implement your idea in the Board Game or Evo Mod.
terms_sec3_text1: We are a chaotic community, but we have standards. The following behavior is strictly prohibited:
terms_sec3_li1: Submitting hate speech, harassment, or explicit content via the suggestion forms.
terms_sec3_li2: Spamming the system with identical role suggestions.
terms_sec3_li3: Impersonating developers or admins in the Telegram group.
terms_sec3_text2: Violators will be banned from the community channels and their suggestions sent to the void.
terms_sec4_text1: This website and its contents (especially the Test Designs) are provided "as is."
terms_sec4_text2: We do not guarantee that the roles on this site are balanced, fair, or fun. Using experimental roles in your games may result in chaos, arguments, or friendship-ending betrayals. Use at your own risk.
terms_sec5_text: Wolf Blood Workshop is a recognized project developed with the knowledge of the original game owners. The website design and core concepts are the intellectual property of @Halfcelse. We actively encourage users to pitch new role ideas and creative mechanics; your contributions are what drive this project forward.
terms_sec6_text: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. If we make major changes, we will notify the pack via our Telegram channel. Continued use of the site constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
lab_warn_text: Use in casual matches or playtesting only. Not recommended for official games... unless you like chaos.
lab_intro:
Try them. Break them. Rebuild them.
We're in test lab mode, and your feedback is the fuel.
desc_bio_village: You're a top soldier. A new version, like version 2.0 of the peasant. Every night you will visit someone. If the player you visit has any kind of homicidal tendencies, you will self-destruct them and everyone who is there at that moment will be unrecognizable. At the same time, if someone tries to kill someone you visit, you will also self-destruct. If you go to the target of a serial killer, he won't die, but he will be injured by the explosion and won't be able to attack the next night. If the Wolves and the Serial Killer attack you, they will kill you.
desc_bio_solo: You're a top soldier. A new version, like version 2.0 of the peasant. Every night you will visit someone and you will cause of an explosion and everyone who is there at that moment will be unrecognizable. At the same time, if someone tries to kill someone you visit, you will also cause an explosion. If you go to the target of a serial killer or they visit you, there might be winner but also can be drawn too. Under the drawn condition you both can not attack next night because of an injury. Against the werewolves, it depends on the pack number.
desc_wolf_blood: You are the original wolf, superior to the alpha and even the first werewolf to give him the curse of infection! You wander apart from the pack and you can't attack every night because you're a very old wolf. If you attack, there is nothing to stop you. On the first try you will kill the wise elder, the serial killer, the arsonist, even the cursed. If you have visitors, they will either die or be infected and turn into werewolves the next day. If they lynch you, you will cause someone else to die. If the soldier lynches you to save someone else, you will die.
desc_shaman: You are the supreme leader, the head of the cultists. First of all, you act independently of the Cultists and recruit people who are different from them into your sect. You can protect yourself from the attacks of a Cult Hunter, Werewolves, Alchemist or Serial Killer with a vodoo spell. You will also have as many votes as the population of all the cultists for one time.
desc_dealbreaker: He is no different from an ordinary villager, but if he tries to be killed in any way, he will reveal the role of a random player and he will survive. If a villager tries to kill him, he will reveal someone's role to the person trying to kill him and will survive thanks to this deal. No deal if he is lynched. He will do the same thing to survive the wolves. This can only happen once, so the second time he risks being killed he will die. The serial killer will kill him outright.
desc_lumberjack: The village's angriest citizen. He tries to curb his anger by chopping wood in the forest. From the night after the woodcutter dies until the end of the day, everyone will double their action. Because the woodcutter's anger will spread all over the village after his death.
desc_scapegoat: He is an ordinary villager like everyone else. However, if there is a disagreement during the lynching (a tie in the lynching), the villagers will be outraged and will choose the Goat/Whipping Boy as their sacrifice. Even if there is a tie in the lynching, there is still a 50% chance that they will hang the Goat/Whipping Boy.
desc_whipping_boy: He is an ordinary villager like everyone else. However, if there is a disagreement during the lynching (a tie in the lynching), the villagers will be outraged and will choose the Goat/Whipping Boy as their sacrifice. Even if there is a tie in the lynching, there is still a 50% chance that they will hang the Goat/Whipping Boy.
desc_raven: At night he can notice the actions of the villagers. Every night he will choose one player, and if that player has an action, he will be able to clearly see what they are doing.
desc_hybrid: A neutral role in his own right. He will only team up with whoever visits him first. If one of the roles in the village visits him, he will slaughter the villagers like a serial killer. If one of the evil roles visits him, he will have no kill function and will be re-teamed with him. He will aim for absolute victory with his partner. They can either finish last together and win or not win at all.
desc_miner: Every night he digs tunnels to the villagers' houses. Thanks to the tunnels he digs, the night action players will always miss their target and end up in a different house. They also won't realize it.
desc_pawn: An honorable soldier dedicated to the king's service. The pawn will sacrifice himself if the person he is protecting is visited by wolves. But if he wants to protect the serial killer's visitor, both he and the person he wants to protect will die.
desc_ritualist: At the night, she will try to switch an alive player role with the dead player role. If their team are same, the ritual will be succeed. But if they are not at the same team, ritualist will die because of breaking the balance of nature.
desc_depressive: Burdened by high-level anxiety and extreme stress, this player is unaware of their true condition and believes they are just an ordinary Villager. If they die by normal means, nothing happens. However, if another player is lynched but this player still received votes during the trial, they suffer a severe panic attack. In a blind frenzy, they will inadvertently cause the death of a random player who voted for them. Consumed by paranoia after the incident, they will succumb to the unbearable stress and take their own life the following day. üòî
desc_kronos: Kronos, the master of time, can accelerate the game by limiting the night and lynching phases to 20 seconds, forcing players to make quick decisions. (6 players and >)
desc_astronomer: The Astronomer watches over the village at night noting how many villagers are awake. By day, he reports any unusual nocturnal activity to the villagers. (7 players and >)
desc_executioner: The Executioner controls the lynching process and can target a villager for execution. The villagers must then vote "Yes" or "No" to carry out the execution. (8 players and >)
desc_successor_wolf: You have a excellent curse. Thanks your ability you can create another successor wolf but for this, you have to die too. At 2. night you will choose a victim for yourself and he became successor, at the same time you will die. After 3 night, your victim will choose another victim for himself and this endless loop will continue until the successor wolf dead with any type of death.
desc_spirit_wolf: If you die, after the night no one can use their action for once and only werewolves/allies can perform action.
desc_sheep_wolf: Choose 2 players. During those players, you can choose one player to make him unable to vote in the next voting phase and mark a target for the other player. That player can still vote but the village will see him voting for the marked player.
desc_bomber: If he manages to survive until half of players are dead, he will explode himself and kill half of the remaining players. He will win if he can explode himself.
desc_myth: This is not a role; it is an ability. The myth will be around every single player‚Äôs body every day. Players will get notified about it and if the werewolves can catch a player who carry the myth, they get 100% infection. This thing will not appear every game but if it appears, it will not go until someone gets bitten.
desc_shadow_master: At first night you have two choices; you can prefer to hide from incoming attacks, or you can possess someone‚Äôs body. If they have any night action you will take over their role entire game and your target will die as ‚Äúdevoured‚Äù. From that moment you cannot defend yourself and you can only use the role ability, or you must back your pure form. If your targets do not have any night action, they will die, and you will look for new prey. You will win if you succeed in being the last player in the game.
desc_dna_sampler: On the 2nd night, you will choose someone to take as a reference. The following night you will choose someone and after the night you will see their DNA result (if they are on the same team or not). Analyses‚Äô results always be true but all villagers‚Äô DNA are not same so the result can be confusing.
desc_announcer: At daytime when he decides he will announce someone‚Äôs night action. It might be seer action, wolf, CH or SK action‚Ä¶ Who knows.
desc_farmer:
You are responsible for field and workers. You will know exactly how many villagers are in the game. But you are not perfect at your job because you also count roles at below;
Lycan ‚Äì Traitor ‚Äì Cursed ‚Äì Wild Child ‚Äì Depressive
desc_fate_bound:
A mystical village elder protected by fate itself. When attacked, the outcome is determined by luck:
‚Ä¢ Against Werewolf:
60% survive, 30% retaliate, 10% die
‚Ä¢ Against Serial Killer:
50% survive, 30% retaliate, 20% die
‚Ä¢ Against Arsonist (burn night):
50% survive, 50% die

This role is a defensive tank with the rare ability to punish killers but fate is a double-edged sword. Investigators will always see you as "mystic but powerless," making trust a luxury.
desc_false_face:
A deceptive and manipulative entity that thrives on confusion. Every night, it marks one player:
That target appears as False Face to all vision roles (Seer, Sorcerer, etc.)
When a new target is marked, the previous one dies immediately.
All actions (investigations, protections, attacks) targeting False Face are redirected randomly including possibly back to the source.

This role has no direct kill ability but eliminates indirectly and causes chaos among vision and power roles.
desc_ninja:
Every night, you can choose to hide from visitors. During your hide, if someone visits you they will not find you. BUT! You will recognize them as a potential threat and you will kill them!
If you choose to hide, Seer will be confused about it and they will see you as Werewolf!
You can't hide 2 times in a row.
desc_mailman: You are different from ordinary mailman's. You deliver the news at night. That's why you are not at home at all.
desc_magneto:
You have a secret ability. For once, you can pull all night actions on yourself.
Who knows, maybe you will be slaughtered by all bad roles or maybe all saviors will be on at the same time üëÄ
desc_janitor: When you die somehow, the following night all lights will be out. And everyone takes their actions blindly.
desc_sismolog:
You are a scientist specializing in earthquakes and earth sciences. Your belief in science makes your role independent of all the players. In case of lynching, there will be a big earthquake in the village! Living players:

‚Ü≥25% will die under rubble due to earthquake
‚Ü≥25% will be trapped under the rubble and unable to act for 1 day
‚Ü≥The 25% will only feel the tremor and realize it
‚Ü≥The remaining 25% will be safe and sound and will feel nothing.
desc_bounty_hunter: You only work for the highest price. At the first night a role will be told you for hunting them. But your target will be also aware of it! They tried to hide but you must detect them. You will have chance to hunt them for every night! If you hunt them successfully, you will win the game!
desc_hacker: You are the Hacker, capable of bypassing the system's firewall while others sleep. Each night, you can perform a system query to receive specific statistics, such as how many evil roles are alive or how many abilities were triggered, allowing you to deduce the game state from the meta-data.
desc_hypnotist: You are the Hypnotist, and reality is whatever you say it is. Each night, you will select a player to plant a false memory in their mind, causing them to receive a fake bot notification that confuses them about what actually happened during the night.
desc_inquisitor: You are the Inquisitor, sent to punish those who remain silent when duty calls. If any player failed to vote during the previous day, you gain the ability to interrogate them the following night, choosing to either learn their true role or execute them immediately for their passivity.
desc_mortician: You are the Mortician, and while the dead tell you their secrets, you decide what the living hear. Each night, you will inspect the victims to see their true role and you have the power to tamper with the public announcement, either hiding the role completely or disguising it as something else.
desc_gossip: You are the Gossip, knowing that a whisper in the dark can be louder than a scream. Each night, you can send an anonymous message to a specific player via the bot, allowing you to manipulate the village or spread fear without ever revealing your identity.
desc_evil_janitor: You are the Janitor, and you make sure there is no evidence left behind. When your team kills a player, you can choose to clean the body so that the victim's role and last will are not revealed to the village upon the death announcement.
desc_transporter: You are the Transporter, deciding where people sleep at night to control the flow of chaos. Each night, you will choose two players to swap their locations, ensuring that any action targeted at one player will land on the other instead.
desc_judge: You are the Judge, and your gavel strikes the final blow when the mob hesitates. During the day, you have the power to immediately end the voting phase, instantly lynching the player with the current majority of votes without further discussion.
